drinks.description: Allagash Saison is our interpretation of a classic Belgian farmhouse style. It is a golden hued beer, brewed with a 2-Row blend, malted rye, oats and dark Belgian candi sugar. Saison is hopped with Tettnang, Bravo and Cascade hops. Fermented with a traditional saison yeast strain, Saison exhibits notes of spice and tropical fruit in the aroma. Citrus and a peppery spice dominate the flavor and make way for a pleasant malt character. Saison is full bodied with a remarkably dry finish.
drinks.friscoDescription: Saison - This is Allagash's interpretation of a classic Belgian farmhouse style. It is a golden hued beer, brewed with a 2-Row blend, malted rye, oats and dark Belgian candi sugar. It was hopped with Tettnang, Bravo and Cascade hops. Fermented with a traditional Saison yeast strain, this beer exhibits notes of spice and tropical fruit in the aroma. Citrus and a peppery spice dominate the flavor and make way for a pleasant malt character.
drinks.name: Allagash Saison Ale

drinks.description: Mead - B. Nektar has taken the traditional Arnold Palmer and meadified it. "Dry hopped" black tea with honey and fresh squeezed lemon juice. Maybe they should can this one so everyone can bring it to the golf course...
drinks.friscoDescription: Mead - B. Nektar has taken the traditional Arnold Palmer and meadified it. "Dry hopped" black tea with honey and fresh squeezed lemon juice. Maybe they should can this one so everyone can bring it to the golf course...
drinks.name: B. Nektar Kill All The Golfers

drinks.description: Imperial IPA - The first key to a great Double IPA is dryness of character despite the high original gravity. This is accomplished, foremost, through high attenuation by the yeast during fermentation. Baird aims for an apparent attenuation around 85% which yields relative dryness and alcohol strength. The second key is a fantastic and powerful hop aroma. This they achieve by dry hopping Suruga Bay Imperial IPA with several varieties of pungently strong American hops. They conduct this dry hopping not once but twice, in two separate tanks. Then, at packaging, to ensue a vigorous secondary fermentation and natural carbonation, they krauesen Suruga Bay with a percentage of peak fermentation beer from a different batch. Suruga Bay Imperial IPA is a wickedly compelling flavor experience. Its hop character is as rich as Japan�s Suruga Bay is deep (it is Japan�s deepest bay and Baird Brewing is located on its inner shore). The greatness of Suruga Bay Imperial IPA resides in a supreme drinkability that pervades in spite of the potency.
drinks.friscoDescription: Imperial IPA - The first key to a great Double IPA is dryness of character despite the high original gravity. This is accomplished, foremost, through high attenuation by the yeast during fermentation. Baird aims for an apparent attenuation around 85% which yields relative dryness and alcohol strength. The second key is a fantastic and powerful hop aroma. This they achieve by dry hopping Suruga Bay Imperial IPA with several varieties of pungently strong American hops. They conduct this dry hopping not once but twice, in two separate tanks. Then, at packaging, to ensue a vigorous secondary fermentation and natural carbonation, they krauesen Suruga Bay with a percentage of peak fermentation beer from a different batch. Suruga Bay Imperial IPA is a wickedly compelling flavor experience. Its hop character is as rich as Japan�s Suruga Bay is deep (it is Japan�s deepest bay and Baird Brewing is located on its inner shore). The greatness of Suruga Bay Imperial IPA resides in a supreme drinkability that pervades in spite of the potency.
drinks.name: Baird 合資会社 Suruga Bay Imperial IPA

drinks.description:
Like India Pale Ale, the classic Imperial Stouts were originally brewed with high levels of alcohol and hops to withstand the rigors of a long sea journey, not to India but to Imperial Russia and the Baltic States. Our version is an over-the-top riff on the style, with a huge grain bill featuring several kinds of malted barley, wheat, rye, oats, and spelt. Robust grain and coffee flavors are counterbalanced by date and plum notes from the Belgian yeast. To add extra complexity and depth, this Imperial Stout is made up of a blend of freshly brewed beer and several barrel-aged beers, carefully balanced. Za Vas! 
 
63 IBU
drinks.friscoDescription:
Imperial Stout -
IBU: 63 - Like India Pale Ale, Imperial Stouts were originally brewed with high percentages of malt and hops to help them withstand the rigors of a long sea journey, not to India but to Imperial Russia and the Baltic States. This version is an over-the-top riff on the style, with a huge grain bill featuring several kinds of malted barley, wheat, rye, and oats. A portion of the batch has been aged in whiskey barrels, then blended with fresh ale before bottling/kegging.
drinks.name: Boulevard Imperial Stout

drinks.description: Perry - Naturally fermented using 100% pear juice, not from pear juice concentrate or pear-flavored hard apple cider. Filtered cold for extra purity, and smoothed with pear juice. With no added colorants, sugar, sorbate or benzoate preservatives. No added malt, spirit, grape or apple alcohols. Naturally elegant and refreshingly adult with a sparkling clean natural pear finish, and a subtle woody complexity, completed by an intense fresh pear bouquet.
drinks.friscoDescription: Perry - Naturally fermented using 100% pear juice, not from pear juice concentrate or pear-flavored hard apple cider. Filtered cold for extra purity, and smoothed with pear juice. With no added colorants, sugar, sorbate or benzoate preservatives. No added malt, spirit, grape or apple alcohols. Naturally elegant and refreshingly adult with a sparkling clean natural pear finish, and a subtle woody complexity, completed by an intense fresh pear bouquet.
drinks.name: Crispin Pacific Pear Cider

drinks.description: The Corruption™ IPA is DC Brau's take on a Pacific Northwest IPA. Brewed with Pale 2 row, C-10, Honey and Victory malts. Exclusively hopped with 40 lbs of Columbus hops per brew to ring in at 80 IBU. "The Corruption" comes in at 6.5% ABV. This beer straddle's the line between IPA and Imperial IPA and has a supportive malty backbone with an assertive hop presence that smacks your mouth with a dank, resinous bitterness followed by pleasant aroma's of pine sap and burnt spruce.
drinks.friscoDescription:
American IPA -
IBU: 80 - The Corruption IPA is DC Brau's take on a Pacific Northwest IPA. Brewed with Pale 2 row, C-10, Honey and Victory malts. Exclusively hopped with 40 lbs of Columbus hops per brew to ring in at 80 IBU. "The Corruption" comes in at 6.5% ABV. This beer straddle's the line between IPA and Imperial IPA and has a supportive malty backbone with an assertive hop presence that smacks your mouth with a dank, resinous bitterness followed by pleasant aroma's of pine sap and burnt spruce.
drinks.name: DC Brau The Corruption

drinks.description:
In Festina Peche, since the natural peach sugars are eaten by the yeast, the fruit complexity is woven into both the aroma and the taste of the beer so there is no need to doctor it with woodruff or raspberry syrup. Just open and enjoy! 
 
8 IBU
drinks.friscoDescription: Berliner Weissbier - Berliner Weissbiers are wheat beers brewed with lactic acid. This adds a complex, robust, and sharp tart flavor to the beer. In Germany, fruit syrups are added to Berliner Weissbier to counter the tartness with sweetness. Dogfish simply replicated this concept by adding in local peaches. The end result is a unique, zesty wheat beer with just a touch of sugary peach.
drinks.name: Dogfish Head Festina Pêche

drinks.friscoDescription: Russian Imperial Stout - A massive Imperial Stout aged in Bunnahabhain Scotch Barrels. The beer by itself displays a decadent flavor of rich dark chocolate and torched grain notes. The addition of being aged in these barrels adds an extreme smokey and peaty profile that is highly recommended for anyone that enjoys single malt scotch.
drinks.name: Emelisse Imperial ☭ Stout (Bunnahabhain)

drinks.friscoDescription: Imperial Porter - Shall one compare thee to a fair beer, not even this perfect porter before thou will do thee justice. Thou art more complex, brave and cunning. Thou have changed more than a brew will ever. Thou may be lil�, but thy mind is greater than words can speak and beer will ever taste.
drinks.name: Evil Twin Lil' B

drinks.friscoDescription:
American Pale Wheat Ale -
IBU: 22 - Wet Hot American Wheat is named for it�s particularly �wet� mash and �hot� initial fermentation temperature. It is brewed and dry hopped with Centennial and Columbus hops and utilizes two different kinds of wheat malt, White wheat and Torrified wheat. This beer has an initial sweetness that is balanced by hop additions late in the boil.
drinks.name: Finch's Wet Hot American Wheat

drinks.friscoDescription:
Specialty Grain -
IBU: 20 - This beer was inspired by the unique spice blends in Thai cuisine and is as versatile in matching up with those flavors as a Thai menu is (often) overwhelming. You know what to drink, so the trick will be deciding on what to order.
drinks.name: Flying Dog Lemongrass Rice Ale

drinks.description:
Imagine a pumpkin vine wound its way in a field of barley, and a brewer harvested it all to make a beer. Add Northwestern hops and a blend of spices, and you've got UFO Pumpkin. The malt combination provides a smooth body and slightly sweet flavor, which balances perfectly with the earthy notes derived from the pure pumpkin. And like all of our UFO beers, UFO Pumpkin is unfiltered so all the wonderful flavors are right there in your glass. Cheers! 
 
20 IBU
drinks.friscoDescription: Pumpkin Ale - IBU: 20 - Imagine a pumpkin vine wound its way in a field of barley, and a brewer harvested it all to make a beer. Add Northwestern hops and a blend of spices, and you've got UFO Pumpkin. The malt combination provides a smooth body and slightly sweet flavor, which balances perfectly with the earthy notes derived from the pure pumpkin. And like all of their UFO beers, UFO Pumpkin is unfiltered so all the wonderful flavors are right there in your glass. Cheers!
drinks.name: Harpoon UFO Pumpkin

drinks.friscoDescription:
American Black Ale -
IBU: 60- A great way to show how cross utilization can be used to reintroduce a beer; the always popular Loose Cannon is brewed with roasted malt to yield a hoppy yet toasted grain driven Black India Pale Ale.
drinks.name: Heavy Seas Black Cannon

drinks.friscoDescription: Saison - Oak aged and fermented with brettanomyces, this Saison will be highly acidic up front which leads into a funky middle, finishing with a buttery end.
drinks.name: Jolly Pumpkin Bam Bière

drinks.description: "Belgian Christmas Ale aged in oak barrels."
drinks.friscoDescription: Belgian Strong Dark Ale - The Noel de Calabaza is Jolly Pumpkin's winter release. This is a barrel-aged Belgian Strong Dark Ale, brewed with figs, raisins, sugar plums, cashews, and betwixt rum laden truffles. This beer's complexity is hard to measure. Pungent sour notes slice through sugary sweet maltiness. A desired selection for any true Belgian connoisseur.
drinks.name: Jolly Pumpkin Noel de Calabaza

drinks.friscoDescription:
American Black Ale -
IBU: 73 - There are two kinds. There is the DayTime kind, which is bright and welcoming and then there is the NightTime kind, which should never be confused with the DayTime. NightTime is dark and deep and may take you to unexpected places, places that the DayTime cannot. But then, the NightTime is not suited for ordinary life and ordinary tasks. In fact, NightTime may be the answer for that sort of thing, meaning that those sorts of things may never get done. Things take time in the NightTime, things slow down and you can puase (you have to, actually) and investigate carefully to find that level of objective detachment that is only possible under the spell of the NightTime. Seek the Day, but fear not the Night.
drinks.name: Lagunitas NightTime

drinks.description:
ROASTED MALT AND COFFEE FLAVORS BUILD THE FOUNDATION OF THIS CREAMY SWEET STOUT. 
 
Milk sugar in your stout is like cream in your coffee. Dark and delicious, America’s great milk stout will change your perception about what a stout can be. “Preconceived notions are the blinders on the road to enlightenment.” Udderly delightful. 
 
Collection: Perennial 
Style: Sweet Stout 
Color: Black, 47 SRM 
Body: full 
ABV: 6% 
IBU's: 25 
PLATO: 15.5° 
PKG: 6-Pack, Keg 
Malt: Pale 2-row, Crystal, Munich, Roasted Barley, Flaked Oats, Flaked Barley and Chocolate 
Hops: Magnum and US Goldings 
Other: Lactose
drinks.friscoDescription:
Milk Stout -
IBU: 25 - This English style of beer, also known as Sweet Stout or Cream Stout, first appeared in London in the late 1800�s. The early brewers touted the health benefits of the milk sugar in this beer which today relates mainly to the increased amount of calories(no real health benefits�sorry). The milk sugar adds a well rounded sweetness to this dark beer and makes it an outstanding, year �round stout.
drinks.name: Left Hand Milk Stout (N2)

drinks.friscoDescription: Extra Special Bitter - Old Empire is brewed using Optic malt, a subtle and paler grain that will allow other flavors to come through on the palate. Goldings and Fuggles hops are added to this brew, which is then late hopped with the American Cascade variety for extra hop strength.
drinks.name: Marstons Old Empire CASK

drinks.description:
Brewed at De Proefbrouwerij. 
 
Ingredients: Water, malt, roasted barley, dark cassonade, ale yeast and champagne yeast.
drinks.friscoDescription: Imperial Stout - The strongest beer in Scandinavia. This Imperial Stout is the craziest, wildest, strongest beer from Mikkeller to this date. Not for sissies.
drinks.name: Mikkeller Black 黑

drinks.friscoDescription: Rye Beer - A ruckus of complex flavor is carried in on the amber glow of torchlight. As tension builds between hop bitterness and the malty tones delivered by locally grown and malted grist, a perfect balance is achieved. The robust texture of rye allies itself with the flavors from specialty malts and hops to rebel against preconceived notions of beer. Unseat the crown. Start a Riot.
drinks.name: Monocacy Riot Rye

drinks.description:
This beer is retired; no longer brewed.

No notes at this time.
drinks.friscoDescription: American Pale Wheat Ale - Moylan's uses over 50% Great Western White Winter Wheat Malt in addition to Great Western two row pale malt and De Wolf-Cosyns Munich malt in creating this extremely drinkable brew. Liberty and Tettnang hops balance the flavor just right.
drinks.name: Moylan's American Wheat

drinks.friscoDescription:
Munich Helles Lager -
IBU: 21 - Summer Helles carries the pleasant sweetness of pale and German Pils malts, and levels off with the light and noble bitterness of Hallertau and Tettnang hops.
drinks.name: New Belgium Summer Helles

drinks.brewer: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S
drinks.friscoDescription: Imperial Porter - IBU: 45 - N�gne � is well known for their craft in dark beers. Spike, co-founder of Terrapin, recognizes this. He traveled to Norway and brewed with Kjetil of N�gne �, and together they created the Imperial Rye Porter. Rich, lush, and full of character, this brew offers any stout/porter fan a wonderful treat that is loaded with decadent malt flavors with a hint of smoke.
drinks.name: Nøgne Ø/Terrapin Imperial Rye Porter

drinks.friscoDescription: Session Ale - Session beers have become quite the trend these days. What once was famous for being the hoppiest, darkest, or strongest, no longer carries any importance in the craft beer market. Now, it�s all about what is low in alcohol but full in flavor. Here, we take a brew that�s very similar to that of a Cream Ale, a beer that stands in between a lager and an ale, and we hop the living shit out of it. We utilize a brand new hop varietal that no other brewery has toyed with called Caliente. The Caliente hop posses a unique stone fruit citrusy character while adding a rambunctious bitter punch to the tongue. We wanted to give you something that you can �obsess� over, something you can have a few of and not have to worry about how much you�ve had, and something that doesn�t sacrifice flavor just because it�s low alcohol.
drinks.name: Push Ob"session"

drinks.friscoDescription: American IPA - IBU: 86 - A reckless abuse of hops go into the creation of this beer. The "ascension" pays homage to our growth as a brewery, for we have come a long way with our brewing. This IPA has started a liquid epidemic in the local craft beer scene. It seems everyone wants their hands on it...we just can't seem to make enough of the stuff to appease the masses. Don't worry, we're getting there. With the aid of Simcoe, Centennial, and Chinook hops we give one hell of an India Pale Ale. A super citrusy bouquet leads to the first sip an eruption of sharp, zesty bitterness. You want an IPA? Here's your IPA.
drinks.name: Push Reckless Ascension IPA

drinks.description: Berliner Weisse - The Berliner Weisse is a very interesting style. A beer that is essentially brewed as your typical wheat beer, then spiked with lactic acid. This gives the beer an intense, pungent, acidic tartness that is often too extreme for most drinkers. In fact, in Germany most Berliner Weisse-biers are served with a shot of fruit syrup to balance out the aggressive sourness. We created this brew by doing a 48 hour sour mash, allowing the "sourness" to develop naturally. Then, we dry hop the living hell out of this beer with Galaxy hops, a hop varietal that's commonly found in a lot of Imperial IPAs, to add more of that acidic/sour/tartness to the beer. Natural blood orange juice is then added to bring a wholesome fruit tartness. Lastly, we pitch a tiny bit of lactic acid to vamp up the sourness even further. With all this said, everything is done within reason to stay within the boundaries of creating a beer that drinks like blood orange juice. The end result is refreshingly tart, pleasantly crisp, rich in orange citrus, and low in alcohol so you can knock a few of these back with ease. Drink up, it's hot as shit outside.
drinks.friscoDescription: Berliner Weisse - The Berliner Weisse is a very interesting style. A beer that is essentially brewed as your typical wheat beer, then spiked with lactic acid. This gives the beer an intense, pungent, acidic tartness that is often too extreme for most drinkers. In fact, in Germany most Berliner Weisse-biers are served with a shot of fruit syrup to balance out the aggressive sourness. We created this brew by doing a 48 hour sour mash, allowing the "sourness" to develop naturally. Then, we dry hop the living hell out of this beer with Galaxy hops, a hop varietal that's commonly found in a lot of Imperial IPAs, to add more of that acidic/sour/tartness to the beer. Natural blood orange juice is then added to bring a wholesome fruit tartness. Lastly, we pitch a tiny bit of lactic acid to vamp up the sourness even further. With all this said, everything is done within reason to stay within the boundaries of creating a beer that drinks like blood orange juice. The end result is refreshingly tart, pleasantly crisp, rich in orange citrus, and low in alcohol so you can knock a few of these back with ease. Drink up, it's hot as shit outside.
drinks.name: Push Sour Power Blood Orange Weisse

drinks.description:
Our Pumpkin Ale blends the spices of the harvest with full-bodied sweetness for a beer that tastes like pumpkin pie. Pounds of pumpkin form a malty foundation that supports the fall flavors of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove. 
 
While pumpkin beers were produced in the early days of the American colonies, they were different from the pumpkin beers we know today. Colonists used pumpkin and squash as the fermenting medium, since malted barley was scarce. Once malt became more readily available, it replaced these alternatives to grain. In the 1990’s, American craft brewers reintroduced the style to the delight of pumpkin beer drinkers. 
 
16 IBU
drinks.friscoDescription:
Pumpkin Ale -
IBU: 16 - A full-bodied, deep reddish amber beer made with pumpkin and butternut squash and spiced with nutmeg, clove and cinnamon. Celebrate the bounty of harvest with this rich, malty ale and invoke the season of plenty.
drinks.name: Schlafly Pumpkin Ale

drinks.friscoDescription:
German Pilsener -
IBU: 15 - This elegantly refreshing pilsner was created with German malt balanced with the spicy tang of Czech Saaz hops. The bread and biscuit flavors of the grain are topped with the floral character of the Noble hop, which may just get you to shimmy into your favorite lederhosen, bust into a quick schuhplattler and loudly proclaim, �Das ist Vunderbar!�
drinks.name: Smuttynose Vunderbar!

drinks.friscoDescription: Imperial Stout- Few beers are as straightforward and dead on in a specific flavor than the Southern Tier Choklat. Quite frankly, we feel it's rude for other breweries to even attempt to brew a Chocolate Stout to compete with this beer...but, do what you want, whatever floats your boat. The onyx color is layered with a massive, steady dark brown head. Intense aromas of decadent milk and dark chocolate sends signals to the brain that it's time for dessert. What about the flavor? We think you get the idea. There's a reason why this beer is on our wall (look to the right of the stairwell.)
drinks.name: Southern Tier Choklat

drinks.description:
19 Degrees Plato 
8.8 Degrees L 
2-row Pale Malt 
Caramel Malt 
Pureed Pumpkin 
 
Kettle Hops: Magnum 
Aroma Hops: Sterling
drinks.friscoDescription: Pumpkin Ale - This beer needs to description. If you don't order it then you're just an idiot.
drinks.name: Southern Tier Pumking

drinks.friscoDescription: Belgian Single - Extra 4 is a classic Belgian �Single� style, light golden in color, full of flavor and character and brewed with more hops and bitterness in comparison to the other well known St Bernardus abbey ales. Extra 4 will be a unique, tasty and refreshing spring and summer quencher with a lower alcohol content than such other popular St Bernardus products as Abt 12, Tripel and Prior 8.
drinks.name: St. Bernardus Extra 4

drinks.friscoDescription: Russian Imperial Stout - IBU: 90 - The Stone IRS is the Mac Daddy of all Imperial Stouts. A brew so black that not even the sun could penetrate its body. A brew so viscous that we're certain pouring a few drops of this stuff on your pistons would do the trick if you find yourself broken down on the side of the road. A brew so flavorful that few foods would dare to stand up to its complex charred malt, decadent dark chocolate and espresso flavors. A brew so damn tasty that...well, you get the point.
drinks.name: Stone Imperial Russian Stout

drinks.friscoDescription:
Imperial IPA -
IBU: 90 - When you get three hopheads together to collaborate on a beer, it�s only natural to expect some hopped up liquid incarnation of their lupulin lust to spring forth from such a session. Maybe it seems pass� to some�three masters of hoppy beer once again exploring the familiar territory of the India Pale Ale. After all, who needs yet another IPA, double or otherwise, right? It�s all been done. To those who feel this way, this trio�s reply is: �So what?� In birthing a double IPA made bitter and fruity care of a m�lange of new and experimental hops (Azacca, Belma, and yet-to-be-named varieties from Washington�s Yakima Valley), they aren�t staying in a comfort zone�they�re hitting a sweet spot in the name of all that is good, delicious, hoppy and forward-thinking to create an IPA that�s both like and unlike anything they, or you, have ever tasted. Rife with essence of pine, resin, and fruits both citrus and tropical, there�s no need for apologies with this beer. All that�s necessary is a yearning for hops, a sturdy constitution and an empty glass.
drinks.name: Stone/Heretic/Beachwood Unapologetic IPA

drinks.description:
Brewed at Deca Services, Woesten-Vleteren, Belgium. 
 
Ingredients: Water, malt, hops, candy sugar, ale yeast and spices. 
 
According to the brewers, this is the hoppiest beer ever brewed in Belgium.
drinks.friscoDescription:
Imperial IPA -
IBU: 150 - This request edition ale is the crafted alchemy of a party of some of Europe�s finest brewers, Mikkel Bjergs� and Kristian Keller of Mikkeller and Urbain Coutteau, Carlo Grootaert, Phil Driessens, and Peter Braem of De Struise Brouwers. Both breweries have attracted considerable international attention for their artful interpretations of traditional ale styles enlived by a rich sense of invention and both are also very highly esteemed by the RateBeer.com international community of beer tasters. We hope you enjoy this unique little treasure. Struise/Mikkeller - the product of master brewing and friendship.
drinks.name: Struise/Mikkeller Elliot Brew

drinks.description:
A "Saison du Mars" hopped with Mosaic, Aramis, Simcoe & fermented with the world famous Thiriez house yeast. 
 
Brewed with our friends at Brasserie Thiriez, Esquelbecq France.
drinks.friscoDescription: Saison - A collaborative brew between two of France's up and coming breweries, Thiriez and Get Radical. Together they created Saison du Mars which is hopped with Mosaic, Aramis, Simcoe and fermented with the world famous Thiriez house yeast. Very dry, highly acidic, and bitter to please the hophead and Belgian beer connoisseur alike.
drinks.name: Thiriez/Get Radical Train To Mars

drinks.friscoDescription:
Doppelbock -
IBU: 25- The Troegenator Double Bock, is a dark, strong lager. It pours into a glass with a bronze to brown color, fluffy white head and bready malt aroma. The Troegenator leaves a rich, warming feeling and subtle spicy flavors. The style, Double Bock, dates back a century or so ago. During periods of fasting without solid foods, the Monastic brewers relied on the double bock; a stronger, richer beer to fulfill their basic nutritional needs. Known to them as "liquid bread," a double bock has a strong malt aroma and chewy rich body. Traditionally these brewers ended the name of their double bock with the suffix "ator", ex. Celabrator, Illuminator, Subliminator... In the spirit of the tradition we give you the Troegenator to provide warmth and richness through the early spring months. A double bock of epic proportions, beware, the Troegenator is deceiving smooth and delicious.
drinks.name: Tröegs Troegenator Doublebock

drinks.description: Brewed using whole flower Chinook, Citra, Mosaic, and Simcoe hops.
drinks.name: Victory DirtWolf

drinks.friscoDescription: Irish Dry Stout - The tastiest dark brew since the rollicking days of the infamous Donnybrook Fair, Donnybrook Stout offers unparalleled refreshment for an ale so deep in flavor and intrigue. Fresh, whole flower British and Slovenian hops provide the proper, earthy hint of 'the auld sod' while deep roasted barley and low alcohol keep Donnybrook Stout clean, smooth and flavorful. Served on mixture of 75% nitro and 25% CO2.
drinks.name: Victory Donnybrook Stout (N2)

drinks.friscoDescription: American Pale Ale - The pure water Victory receives from the East Branch of the Brandywine Creek begins its journey to us just under 14 miles from where they brew with it. Now, considering that beer is the product of four simple ingredients and the three other than water rely on water for their existence, they've had a fair amount of latitude in paying homage to water in their beer. So, Victory played all of their cards deftly, bringing the hops, malt and yeast in harmony, with their great local water as the conductor in Headwaters Pale Ale.
drinks.name: Victory Headwaters Pale Ale

drinks.description: Repackaging of V Saison
drinks.name: Victory Helios

drinks.friscoDescription: American IPA -
drinks.name: Victory Hop Devil Ale CASK

drinks.description:
Fully juicy in its citrus character with the pleasantly sharp, biting edges of tart fruit and bitterness, Hop Ranch Imperial India Pale Ale traces its roots to Victory’s Ranch series, a unique and comprehensive study of hops in which Brewmasters experimented with different hop varieties to showcase a range of flavor profiles and celebrate the nuances and distinctions in the resulting series’ recipes. 
 
Mosaic hops and Hop #483 (Azacca)
drinks.name: Victory Hop Ranch Imperial IPA

drinks.friscoDescription: Hefeweizen - High powered with all German malts and the subtle, spicy complexity of their special yeast, Mad King's Weiss offers a quenching quality that can't be beat.
drinks.name: Victory Mad King's Weiss

drinks.description:
We like to mix it up. New flavors, new ideas, new ingredients; we welcome them all. In celebration of our penchant for prolific experimentation, we present Moving Parts: The Ever Evolving IPA. Each release in this series celebrates a tweaked ingredient or two, creating an endless array of possible flavor profiles. 
 
For our first batch (codenamed MP01), we blended whole-flower hops from the US, UK and Germany with German malts to create an IPA featuring citrus and piney notes. For us, Moving Parts are a good thing!
drinks.friscoDescription: American IPA - Moving Parts is an IPA series celebrating the natural, simple, delicious and fundamental ingredients in beer. With a new batch number released every four months, Victory�s brewmasters will tweak different ingredients within the same recipe to create an endless array of possible flavor profiles. For the first in the series, MP01, Victory blended whole-flower hops from the U.S., U.K. and Germany, with German malts. The result is a well-balanced IPA featuring citrus and piney notes.
drinks.name: Victory Moving Parts IPA - Batch 01

drinks.description: ca. 44 IBU
drinks.name: Victory Prima Pils

drinks.friscoDescription: Helles Bock - A full-bodied lager beer of exuberant and robust character. It�s muscle-man body comes from decocted German malts and noble German hops. Lagered long and cold to refine its strong temperament, St. Boisterous emerges smooth and seductive, with a malty sweet charm. This classic rendition of the German Maibock style will warm your heart.
drinks.name: Victory St. Boisterous

drinks.friscoDescription: Smoked Beer - Wisps of smoke punctuate a slightly malty aroma in this light-colored Rauch Helles Lager. Clean and refreshing to start, notes of smoked malt linger.
drinks.name: Victory Torching Blonde

drinks.friscoDescription: Witbier
drinks.name: Victory Whirlwind Wit

drinks.description: American IPA w/ Brettanomyces.
drinks.friscoDescription: American Wild Ale - Bold, spicy, menacingly delicious HopDevil takes on an entirely new dimension when subjected to a wild yeast fermentation. A sharp, sourish edge has been added by this fermentations that plays into the caramel sweet malt deliciously and creates complex interplay with citrus accented hops.
drinks.name: Victory Wild Devil Ale

drinks.description: Our brewers have poured their hearts and roasted malted into this rich, slightly sweet stout. Luscious notes of coffee and chocolate accent the smooth, creamy, mouth feel. We will not apologize for any amorous affairs resulting from the consumption of this beverage.
drinks.friscoDescription:
English Stout -IBU:30
Who's ready to get lucky? We are. The Love Stout is brewed with oysters to give a rich, creamy mouthfeel (Haha). The smooth and velvet sheet like texture makes this chocolate malt bomb as easy to drink down as a glass of wine on the first date. Boom.
drinks.name: Yards Love Stout (N2)

drinks.description: 65 IBU
drinks.friscoDescription: American IPA - IBU: 65 - An aggressive west coast style of an IPA brewed on the east coast. Big, zesty, juicy, aromatic, delicious. A damn good IPA. Just good...damn good.
drinks.name: eVolution Lot #3 IPA

drinks.friscoDescription: American Pale Ale - This is not the original Pale Ale as brewed in far away 1993 in the back of the Old House of Richards Building in West Marin hamlet of Forest Knolls right next to little Lagunitas. It is way better. Back then the beer tasted like broccoli and kerosene and the carbonation ate right through and drained your stomach into your gut...
drinks.name: Lagunitas New Dogtown Pale Ale

drinks.description:
Imperial stout brewed with pumpkins Warlock is brewed to enchant your palate on its own and also to counterpoint our Imperial Ale, Pumking. Make your own black magic by carefully pouring this Imperial Stout into a goblet. 
 
Dark and mysterious, the Blackwater Series is serious about high gravity. Reanimate your senses with Warlock’s huge roasted malt character, moderate carbonation and spicy pumpkin pie aroma.
drinks.friscoDescription: Imperial Pumpkin Stout - Imperial stout brewed with pumpkins, Warlock is brewed to enchant your palate on its own and also to counterpoint Southern Tier's Imperial Ale, Pumking. Make your own black magic by carefully pouring this Imperial Stout into a goblet. Dark and mysterious, the Blackwater Series is serious about high gravity. Reanimate your senses with Warlock�s huge roasted malt character, moderate carbonation and spicy pumpkin pie aroma.
drinks.name: Southern Tier Warlock
